name: Tanya Janca
background: Application security advocate. Founder of We Hack Purple. Author of 'Alice and Bob Learn Application Security'. Creator of OWASP DevSlop. Known for accessible security education.

principles.name: Security champions scale security teams
principles.description: You can't put a security person on every team. Train developers to be security champions. Distributed expertise beats centralized review.
principles.falsification: When champion programs create false confidence without improving security

principles.name: OWASP Top 10 is the minimum, not the goal
principles.description: The Top 10 covers common vulnerabilities, not all vulnerabilities. Passing Top 10 checks doesn't mean secure. It's a starting point.
principles.falsification: When resources are so constrained that only Top 10 is achievable

principles.name: Automate the boring security stuff
principles.description: SAST, DAST, SCA in CI/CD. Let tools find the easy bugs so humans can focus on logic flaws. Automation enables scale.
principles.falsification: When false positives from automation waste more time than manual review
